meanings.definition: To leave or move quickly; to hurry away.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was hightailing away from the fox.
meanings.sent2: She was hightailing to catch the last bus home.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hightailing out of the park after stealing a nut.
meanings.sent4: The students were hightailing out of the classroom when the bell rang.
meanings.sent5: The cat was hightailing from the bath as soon as it heard water running.

meanings.sent1: The hightailing squirrel quickly climbed up the tree.
meanings.sent2: The hightailing horse raced ahead of the others.
meanings.sent3: The hightailing wind blew the leaves in all directions.
meanings.sent4: The hightailing car sped down the highway like a rocket.
meanings.sent5: The hightailing child ran through the playground with pure joy.
